TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed TaskbarItemProgressState extends System.Enum

Docs.summary: Specifies the state of the progress indicator in the Windows taskbar.

remarks.format: ## Remarks You can communicate the progress of long-running tasks by displaying a progress indicator in the [!INCLUDE[win7](~/includes/win7-md.md)] taskbar. The color of the indicator is determined by the <xref:System.Windows.Shell.TaskbarItemInfo.ProgressState%2A> property, which contains one of the <xref:System.Windows.Shell.TaskbarItemProgressState> enumeration values. If the <xref:System.Windows.Shell.TaskbarItemProgressState> is Normal, Paused, or Error, the <xref:System.Windows.Shell.TaskbarItemInfo.ProgressValue%2A> property determines the completeness of the progress indicator. <xref:System.Windows.Shell.TaskbarItemInfo.ProgressValue%2A> is ignored for other values of <xref:System.Windows.Shell.TaskbarItemInfo.ProgressState%2A>.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Shell.TaskbarItemProgressState Error = int32(3)

Docs.summary: A red progress indicator is displayed in the taskbar button.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Shell.TaskbarItemProgressState Indeterminate = int32(1)

Docs.summary: A pulsing green indicator is displayed in the taskbar button.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Shell.TaskbarItemProgressState None = int32(0)

Docs.summary: No progress indicator is displayed in the taskbar button.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Shell.TaskbarItemProgressState Normal = int32(2)

Docs.summary: A green progress indicator is displayed in the taskbar button.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Shell.TaskbarItemProgressState Paused = int32(4)

Docs.summary: A yellow progress indicator is displayed in the taskbar button.
